children.tweet: @sheddenm @DZRishmawy yeah and that's my point. I'm at a UMC in a very progressive city.
@zhoag @DZRishmawy which mainline did you move to? Also, this is really broad brushstrokes. Diversity exists on both sides.
@sheddenm @DZRishmawy I’ve been embraced so far despite difference, & see great potential for fresh expressions w evangelical spirit.
@zhoag but I meant if switch because of social issues and try to bring some evangelical traits you'll be in a losing battle often.
@sheddenm @DZRishmawy thanks Matthew :).
@zhoag @DZRishmawy Congrats on joining Wesley. Because of him the UMC is an often an odd exception to many of evangelical/ml issues.
@zhoag I guess I mean thinking about the things many people like evangelical churches: the piety, the worship, small groups, etc.
@zhoag tough to say. Post-liberal theology used to have more hope in evangelicals because of the priority of scripture.
@zhoag And I think if they can learn to hold that differently they might have hope.
@zhoag My own denomination is choosing between the two options or seeking a middle road. It's really not working that well.
@sheddenm @zhoag yes. It's precisely the vague commitment to "evang" with no denom experience or connexion that let's it be so pernicious
@sheddenm @zhoag see what I did with Wesley there? ;)
@zhoag @JBoRussell ha, a29 has its own giant list of problems.
@JBoRussell truth, a29 as prime example. @sheddenm
@zhoag @sheddenm Lord hear our prayer. Hope so!
@sheddenm @zhoag because they've seen how nastily sharkish evang has been
@zhoag @JBoRussell Amen to that, but they often seem just as closed to that as evangelicals are to a good diversity.
@JBoRussell @sheddenm and reform can happen esp as ML denoms are in need of life-giving practices that some evangelicals do really well.
@sheddenm @zhoag that last tweet was suppose to end with this ;)
@sheddenm @zhoag not sure how it can say anything other than some Evans and listening/want to tap prog minded folks
@JBoRussell @zhoag I think what happened says as much as evang. culture as it does progressive. Esp. at the extremes but even in the middle.
@sheddenm @zhoag plenty of room for nuance in realizing it was a misstep in reading their market ;) the submissive apology makes it clear..
@JBoRussell @zhoag I'd have a more nuanced view of what happened the last 2days but I think it shows some things aren't as far as they hoped
@sheddenm @zhoag yesterday gave some writ large insights of the power dynamics those teetering need to see tho...
@JBoRussell @zhoag Yes. It really depends on the entire logic for leaving and the attachment to what is left behind. Could go either way.
@sheddenm @zhoag perhaps. I predict many will be liberated by a slight relief from heavily heart focused/internalist logic of evan. disc tho
@JBoRussell @zhoag But I do think many will struggle with what is often a hands off approach to discipleship and belief in the mainline.
@zhoag @sheddenm many hip evang. nondenoms appear that way...but have intense normativity standards lurking
@sheddenm I can see that in the "spectrum". Wondering - can you see more nuance/openness happening in evang. denoms?
@zhoag we are just talking about different things. In that sense I agree, they'll baptize you, but if you still have some evangelical you in
@zhoag you might be shocked by the person behind you who denies what you might still consider central tenants of the faith.
@sheddenm @DZRishmawy disagree - far more likely to be *actually restricted* (baptism/membership/leadership) w/in evang. denoms.
@zhoag @DZRishmawy acceptance of 'that diversity' is nowhere near a given. Probably as much as given as it is in the evangelical world.
@DZRishmawy @sheddenm @UMCburlington true at the denom level, our local level is surprisingly living in the tension.
@zhoag @sheddenm @UMCburlington Maybe. But, again, it's polarizing right now even there.
@DZRishmawy right. So might that more "open" evang. ethos church in the ML be the place progressives end up? @sheddenm @UMCburlington
@zhoag @sheddenm @UMCburlington Well, again, it's a bit more complicated because their are Evangelical-ethos churches in ML denoms
@DZRishmawy right. I guess I'm wondering about a counter-exodus here. @sheddenm @UMCburlington
@zhoag @sheddenm @UMCburlington ML is what we think of as ML, partially by the exodus or eviction of the conservative Evangelicals
@DZRishmawy @sheddenm @UMCburlington but there's some absurdity there Derek, as that would erase distinction between evang. &ML denoms.
@zhoag @sheddenm @UMCburlington See, I'm coming at it from seeing ML forcing conformity to "diversity" on issues of ecclesial conviction
@DZRishmawy @sheddenm @UMCburlington the only "social orthodoxy" is acceptance of that diversity - which is my point w the orig. question.
@DZRishmawy @sheddenm we are diverse socially at @UMCburlington even at leader level, & there is understanding among ppl.
@sheddenm @zhoag "If you agree on the social issue." See, that's my point. They have a social orthodoxy that function like a doctrinal one
@DZRishmawy @zhoag more likely they don't use a word at all if you agree on the social issues. They'll just quietly ignore your evngl habits
@DZRishmawy @sheddenm haha perhaps. hasn’t been my experience - then again, i would not be “evangelical” by some standards.
@sheddenm @zhoag They don't use the h-word, but the O-word "oppressor", or some such variant, is an option for the. Or the f-word (fundy) ;)
@zhoag @DZRishmawy True, the H word is used in Evangelical culture. The ml isn't going to call you that but it will have similar issues.
@sheddenm @DZRishmawy but what I'm saying is there's often the threat of "heresy" on the conservative side, not so much on the other.
@DZRishmawy @zhoag Exactly. If you're mainly concerned about progressive social issues it will work but you'll lose other things.
@zhoag @sheddenm As long as you're not too Evangelical. There are boundaries that get policed on the other end too
@zhoag in my experience (grew up mainline, attended through seminary) they often have less room for the 'good' things considered evangelical
@sheddenm In the sense that there's more "room" for nuanced/progressive evangelicals in mainline denoms.
@zhoag what do you mean by gravitation toward the mainline?
@zhoag I have one foot in both worlds. The last few days have caused me to question how much longer I can sustain that.
@zhoag ha, I totally read "denoms" as "demons"
@laurensydneyw :)
@lowms Thank you!
@laurensydneyw Great piece of writing!
@zhoag @WorldVision As a millennial, I almost wish we could redefine 'evangelical' in the midst of this mess.  http://t.co/rRVSJs14MR
@zhoag @WorldVision idk? I attend a small evangelically identified church that is fairly removed from the larger trends in Christian culture
@zhoag being removed from larger Christian culture has been the best thing. I didn't even know who Driscoll was until a few years ago!
@zhoag I was already attending my local Episcopal church, but I am very relieved to be leaving my evang liberal arts school in May.
@zhoag Already did a few years ago when it became clear that evangelicals were making homosexuality a litmus-test issue. (1/2)
@joshmrowley yeah, i think that’s going to become a common journey.
@zhoag I had one foot in the evangelical world (Young Life, Fuller) and one foot in the mainline world (Austin Seminary, PCUSA). (2/2)
@zhoag @WorldVision Have been migrating that way for some months, but yes, this was a catalyst.
@zhoag I suppose I’m no longer sure who is willing to share the table w/ me -even friends- that might be my only requirement at this point
@zhoag but I’m hoping more to just realize that the conversations/controversies Evang. rotate on are simply not germane to where I’m called
@eloranicole Nice. I'm enjoying it so far. Looking at maybe starting the track to become a licensed pastor.
@eloranicole Down the road a ways, but still, looking. :)
@culturalsavage We're Evangelical Covenant too :)
@zhoag I'm part of the Evangelical Covenant Church. there feels like lots of room there.
@zhoag I think that ppl that fall on the left of Evangelical spectrum get lumped as progressive, so we only wee right end as 'Evangelical"
@CulturalSavage cool. I'm not disassociating from the label (completely) either. Wondering about organizational room tho.
@CulturalSavage @zhoag Wonder if 1 Cor 1:11-13 is relevant here. "I am of Paul... I am of Peter... I am progressive... I am conservative">>>
@kootenayrev @CulturalSavage I don’t prog evangelicals are advocating exclusion here, just the reverse.
@CulturalSavage @zhoag We need the wisdom to know when to exclude (1cor 5:2) and when not to (Gal 2:11-14).
@CulturalSavage @zhoag @kootenayrev Thanks guys. Pivot to testimony bridges the otherwise inevitable schism. Blogging on topic this weekend.
@JohnWHawthorne @zhoag @kootenayrev I like this. Gets back to the roots of evangelicalism. Testimony and witness are huge.
@zhoag @kootenayrev @CulturalSavage Evangelicals will be known by telling story of how Christ moved in their lives, not positions they hold.
@zhoag @JohnWHawthorne @kootenayrev There is going to be a schism between denom/politics/policies and this new way. I give it  years.
@JohnWHawthorne @zhoag @kootenayrev I ment 3 years originally. Typo.
@CulturalSavage @zhoag @kootenayrev Is this a continuation of your previous post? Big difference between "give it years" and "2-3 years".
@zhoag @JohnWHawthorne @kootenayrev Maybe 2-3 yrs at the most.
@CulturalSavage @zhoag @JohnWHawthorne @kootenayrev Not that abuse of power doesn't happen everywhere…I'm just over the the god of 1/2
@jess_h_b @CulturalSavage @zhoag @kootenayrev Hi Jess. I'm also in the Mitten state! Not defending past abuse but building on Acts 8: 25-40.
@CulturalSavage @zhoag @JohnWHawthorne @kootenayrev individualism 2/2
@CulturalSavage @zhoag @JohnWHawthorne @kootenayrev that have no accountability/ checks&balances & bad things happen (abuse of power)
@CulturalSavage @zhoag @JohnWHawthorne @kootenayrev IDK, but I have been a part of & witness to independent evangelical churches 1/2
@jess_h_b @zhoag @JohnWHawthorne @kootenayrev who would you have us be accountable to, other than Christ through the Holy Spirit?
@jess_h_b @zhoag @JohnWHawthorne @kootenayrev Oh, and mutually to eachother.
@zhoag @JohnWHawthorne @kootenayrev @CulturalSavage Yes, more individualism and low/no accountability. Yippee! :/
@JohnWHawthorne @kootenayrev @CulturalSavage hmm. This is opening the door for a new evangelical identity beyond denom/org policies? Me like
@zhoag @kootenayrev @CulturalSavage my thesis: evangelical is not denominational but will emerge as new form of post-christiandom witness.
.@kootenayrev @CulturalSavage Also, I’m not advocating for mass exodus/schism. I overlap mainline/evang. & have chastened optimism.
@CulturalSavage @zhoag Yes. Regardless of one's PoV division is hard 2avoid. We're wired like that. We need grace (horizontally &vertically)
@kootenayrev @zhoag I think yes in many ways. Still it is hard when some ppl exclude you b/c you are nor conservative or progressive enough.
@CulturalSavage @zhoag >>> might we be opening ourselves up to the same rebuke?
@zhoag I'm still determined to reform from within. I'm still calling myself evangelical (among other things). I'm not ready to give it up.

tweet: So are any evangelicals gravitating toward the mainline after the @WorldVision mess? Any of you still determined to help evangelical denoms?
